result.name: irish-sea-and-bristol-channel-plankton-survey-rv-cirolana-04b-96
result.notes:
This survey was carried out in the Irish Sea and Bristol Channel between 12th 
and 26th April 1996. As part of the aims of this survey, a grid of stations in 
the western Irish Sea was sampled for plankton. A further set of plankton 
stations was sampled in an area south of Milford Haven and across the Bristol 
Channel to provide an indication of fish egg and larval distributions 
following the Sea Empress oil spill and enable comparison with previous years.

The data described here consists of the numbers of ichthyo- and zooplankton 
analysed and *Nephrops* larvae, along with associated positional and 
ancillary data and volumes filtered.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Irish Sea and Bristol Channel Plankton Survey - RV Cirolana 04b/96

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
